001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.

004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Meters;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.proto.Transform2dProto;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.struct.Transform2dStruct;
011import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Distance;
012import edu.wpi.first.util.protobuf.ProtobufSerializable;
013import edu.wpi.first.util.struct.StructSerializable;
014import java.util.Objects;
015
016/** Represents a transformation for a Pose2d in the pose's frame. */
017public class Transform2d implements ProtobufSerializable, StructSerializable {
018  /**
019   * A preallocated Transform2d representing no transformation.
020   *
021   * <p>This exists to avoid allocations for common transformations.
022   */
023  public static final Transform2d kZero = new Transform2d();
024
025  private final Translation2d m_translation;
026  private final Rotation2d m_rotation;
027
028  /**
029   * Constructs the transform that maps the initial pose to the final pose.
030   *
031   * @param initial The initial pose for the transformation.
032   * @param last The final pose for the transformation.
033   */
034  public Transform2d(Pose2d initial, Pose2d last) {
035    // We are rotating the difference between the translations
036    // using a clockwise rotation matrix. This transforms the global
037    // delta into a local delta (relative to the initial pose).
038    m_translation =
039        last.getTranslation()
040            .minus(initial.getTranslation())
041            .rotateBy(initial.getRotation().unaryMinus());
042
043    m_rotation = last.getRotation().minus(initial.getRotation());
044  }
045
046  /**
047   * Constructs a transform with the given translation and rotation components.
048   *
049   * @param translation Translational component of the transform.
050   * @param rotation Rotational component of the transform.
051   */
052  public Transform2d(Translation2d translation, Rotation2d rotation) {
053    m_translation = translation;
054    m_rotation = rotation;
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Constructs a transform with x and y translations instead of a separate Translation2d.
059   *
060   * @param x The x component of the translational component of the transform.
061   * @param y The y component of the translational component of the transform.
062   * @param rotation The rotational component of the transform.
063   */
064  public Transform2d(double x, double y, Rotation2d rotation) {
065    m_translation = new Translation2d(x, y);
066    m_rotation = rotation;
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Constructs a transform with x and y translations instead of a separate Translation2d. The X and
071   * Y translations will be converted to and tracked as meters.
072   *
073   * @param x The x component of the translational component of the transform.
074   * @param y The y component of the translational component of the transform.
075   * @param rotation The rotational component of the transform.
076   */
077  public Transform2d(Distance x, Distance y, Rotation2d rotation) {
078    this(x.in(Meters), y.in(Meters), rotation);
079  }
080
081  /** Constructs the identity transform -- maps an initial pose to itself. */
082  public Transform2d() {
083    m_translation = Translation2d.kZero;
084    m_rotation = Rotation2d.kZero;
085  }
086
087  /**
088   * Multiplies the transform by the scalar.
089   *
090   * @param scalar The scalar.
091   * @return The scaled Transform2d.
092   */
093  public Transform2d times(double scalar) {
094    return new Transform2d(m_translation.times(scalar), m_rotation.times(scalar));
095  }
096
097  /**
098   * Divides the transform by the scalar.
099   *
100   * @param scalar The scalar.
101   * @return The scaled Transform2d.
102   */
103  public Transform2d div(double scalar) {
104    return times(1.0 / scalar);
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Composes two transformations. The second transform is applied relative to the orientation of
109   * the first.
110   *
111   * @param other The transform to compose with this one.
112   * @return The composition of the two transformations.
113   */
114  public Transform2d plus(Transform2d other) {
115    return new Transform2d(Pose2d.kZero, Pose2d.kZero.transformBy(this).transformBy(other));
116  }
117
118  /**
119   * Returns the translation component of the transformation.
120   *
121   * @return The translational component of the transform.
122   */
123  public Translation2d getTranslation() {
124    return m_translation;
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Returns the X component of the transformation's translation.
129   *
130   * @return The x component of the transformation's translation.
131   */
132  public double getX() {
133    return m_translation.getX();
134  }
135
136  /**
137   * Returns the Y component of the transformation's translation.
138   *
139   * @return The y component of the transformation's translation.
140   */
141  public double getY() {
142    return m_translation.getY();
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Returns the X component of the transformation's translation in a measure.
147   *
148   * @return The x component of the transformation's translation in a measure.
149   */
150  public Distance getMeasureX() {
151    return m_translation.getMeasureX();
152  }
153
154  /**
155   * Returns the Y component of the transformation's translation in a measure.
156   *
157   * @return The y component of the transformation's translation in a measure.
158   */
159  public Distance getMeasureY() {
160    return m_translation.getMeasureY();
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Returns the rotational component of the transformation.
165   *
166   * @return Reference to the rotational component of the transform.
167   */
168  public Rotation2d getRotation() {
169    return m_rotation;
170  }
171
172  /**
173   * Invert the transformation. This is useful for undoing a transformation.
174   *
175   * @return The inverted transformation.
176   */
177  public Transform2d inverse() {
178    // We are rotating the difference between the translations
179    // using a clockwise rotation matrix. This transforms the global
180    // delta into a local delta (relative to the initial pose).
181    return new Transform2d(
182        getTranslation().unaryMinus().rotateBy(getRotation().unaryMinus()),
183        getRotation().unaryMinus());
184  }
185
186  @Override
187  public String toString() {
188    return String.format("Transform2d(%s, %s)", m_translation, m_rotation);
189  }
190
191  /**
192   * Checks equality between this Transform2d and another object.
193   *
194   * @param obj The other object.
195   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
196   */
197  @Override
198  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
199    return obj instanceof Transform2d other
200        && other.m_translation.equals(m_translation)
201        && other.m_rotation.equals(m_rotation);
202  }
203
204  @Override
205  public int hashCode() {
206    return Objects.hash(m_translation, m_rotation);
207  }
208
209  /** Transform2d protobuf for serialization. */
210  public static final Transform2dProto proto = new Transform2dProto();
211
212  /** Transform2d struct for serialization. */
213  public static final Transform2dStruct struct = new Transform2dStruct();
214}
